alert.note: Alert for Marion; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 10:10AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Marion and Sequatchie. * WHEN...Until 115 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1008 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This recent rain is falling over areas that already received substantial rainfall earlier. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dunlap, Whitwell, Fairmount, Powells Crossroads, Cartwright, Chimneys State Park, Griffith Creek, Martin Springs, Lone Oak and North Chickamauga Creek Gorge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
